intro: Corydalis hendersonii var. hendersonii, commonly known as the Henderson's corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant has slender, branching stems and produces small, ovate leaves with a hairy texture. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is sometimes cultivated in specialty gardens.
